paragraph: Edwin Makromallis, also known as Ed Case, is a London-based musician, producer, songwriter, and DJ.

Edwin Makromallis' musical talent was evident at a young age.  He achieved 'merits' and 'distinctions' up to grade 5 with the piano. At 15, he took part in a work placement opportunity at a recording studio, where he learnt the techniques of audio production.

Ed Case began his music career in the illegal rave scene of the late 1980s. This was followed by a stint working in hardcore and drum & bass clubs. Case however made his name in the UK garage scene of the late 1990s. He hosted a show on pirate radio, Freek FM. He released a string of underground hits, including "Something in Your Eyes" featuring Shelley Nelson, which peaked at 38 in the UK top 40. This track represented a dual turning point, since it was the first time Case had had a track chart, and prior, Case had only used vocal samples, and it was the first time he had worked with a live vocalist in his studio. Ed Case achieved a greater level of mainstream pop fame with his remix of Gorillaz' "Clint Eastwood". He selected that track to remix because the original was 'quite slow', and he thought that his best contribution could be made in the form of a more energetic version, featuring MC Sweetie Irie.
Ed Case linked up with Dan Genal as in early 2013 to form State Unknown. They have performed DJ sets around the world, playing 'underground bass-driven tracks'.
Makromallis is currently pursuing a career involving producing scores for film, television and advertising.
Da Vibes EP - Donna Cousins & Ed Case (1998), Thirst Records
"Something in Your Eyes" (1999/2000), Unit Five Records/Red Rose Recordings - UK #38
"When I'm with You" (feat. Valerie M) (2000), FTL
"Dun Know We / Hold It Up" (feat. N.S. A) (2002), Killer Instinct
The Full Throttle EP (2006), Quality Control
"Holding On" - (DJ Sparks & Ed Case feat. Louise (2006), Quality Control
"All I Wanna Do" (feat. Oggie) (2007), Quality Control
"River of Love" (with Shelley Nelson) (2008), Quality Control
"Past Love" (2016), M.I. RawAs Ed Case & Carl HSteppas EP (1998), Thirst Records
"Carnival Blues / Sound Boy" (feat. Spee) (1998), Middlerow Records
"Hard on Me / Milo's Tune" (1998), Middlerow Records
"I am Here" (feat. Frankie Paul) (1999), Ultimate Beats
